content.description:
The system represented by the equation shown is at equilibrium in a rigid container.

<math overflow="scroll"> <mi>CO</mi> <mo stretchy="false">(</mo> <mi>g</mi> <mo stretchy="false">)</mo> <mo>+</mo> <mn>2</mn> <mspace width="0.25em"> </mspace> <msub> <mi mathvariant="normal">H</mi> <mn>2</mn> </msub> <mo stretchy="false">(</mo> <mi>g</mi> <mo stretchy="false">)</mo> <mo>⇄</mo> <msub> <mi>CH</mi> <mn>3</mn> </msub> <mspace width="-0.1em"> </mspace> <mi>OH</mi> <mo stretchy="false">(</mo> <mi>g</mi> <mo stretchy="false">)</mo> <mspace width="1.00em"> </mspace> <mi mathvariant="normal">Δ</mi> <mi>H</mi> <mo mathvariant="italic">°</mo> <mo>=</mo> <mo>-</mo> <mn>90</mn> <mspace width="0.25em"> </mspace> <mi>kJ</mi> <mo>/</mo> <msub> <mi>mol</mi> <mrow> <mi>r</mi> <mi>x</mi> <mi>n</mi> </mrow> </msub> </math>
content.question: Which of the following would decrease the amount of the reactant <math alttext="C O, gas" overflow="scroll"> <mi>CO</mi> <mo stretchy="false">(</mo> <mi>g</mi> <mo stretchy="false">)</mo> </math> in the container?

choices.label: Adding <math alttext="C H 3 O H, gas" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>CH</mi><mn>3</mn></msub><mspace width="-0.1em"></mspace><mi>OH</mi><mo stretchy="false">(</mo><mi>g</mi><mo stretchy="false">)</mo></math> to the container

Removing <math alttext="H 2, gas" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi mathvariant="normal">H</mi><mn>2</mn></msub><mpadded><mo>(</mo><mpadded><mi>g</mi></mpadded><mo>)</mo></mpadded></math> from the container

skill.text: 2.B: Formulate a hypothesis or predict the results of an experiment.
